post_text: Congratulations to DeKalb School of the Arts for being recognized as the Georgia Department of Education School of the Day! #iLoveDCSD
shared_text:
Georgia Department of Education
September 9 at 10:25 AM ·

SCHOOL OF THE DAY: DeKalb School of the Arts, DeKalb County School District -- home of the Fire Ants!

DeKalb School of the Arts is a high-performing arts magnet program in DeKalb County, offering instruction in eight arts disciplines. During the COVID-19 pandemic, school leaders have planned a wide array of virtual theatre, dance, and music performances to show on social media, the district TV program, and other avenues.

To best accommodate students during virtual learning, the school distributed Chromebooks and hotspots to students who need them and hosted two drive-through distributions of textbooks for students. Students are still engaged with the school through daily virtual announcements and virtual club meetings. Principal George Greene also holds family engagement sessions on Fridays via Microsoft Teams.

Georgia has more than 2,000 public schools, all unique and working hard to expand opportunities and offer a high-quality education to their students. Through this feature, we'll introduce you to a new school each day. #GaDOESchooloftheDay #GAPublicSchoolsTogether

post_text:
Greetings DeKalb County School District students, staff, and community stakeholders,

The DeKalb County School District (DCSD) sought stakeholder input on their preferences and perspectives for learning models and hybrid options for the reopening of schools. This feedback includes the stakeholders’ level of comfort with social distancing and hygiene efforts, school bus transportation, employee travel, serving meals, taking students’ temperature, access to supplies, technology, internet usage at home, and the use of masks at school and on the bus.

Superintendent Cheryl Watson-Harris and the DCSD administrative team have explored all options and the proposed plan will be shared today, July 13, 2020, with the DeKalb County Board of Education during its meeting for review and discussion. To review the Stakeholder Input Survey results, please visit https://www.dekalbschoolsga.org/covid-19/covid-19/update-33/. Thank you.
